content.description: there are a couple very good undone lines on these boulders, especially the arete on the main boulder.

Start with a good hand jam in the obvious crack and a large block for a foot. Make moves out right to large holds and continue up the crack with a heel hook and top out. 

youtube.com/watch?v=7yw-_9h…
content.location: located on boulder right along the green trail. The crack is very obvious.

content.description:
Start on a large undercling with you feet smeared. Grab the ear with your right hand and make your way to a couple cool holds on the arete and finish by standing up on another smear.  

  Interesting climbing on good rock, the arete is beautifully shaped.
content.location:
100 feet from the main boulder. 

  hop a stone wall and walk for two seconds. It's really the only cleaned problem on this boulder and not hard to find.

content.description: Stand start with a pinch and an undercling. Grab large quartz holds and finish using a small crack and then jugs.
content.location: on the tall, vertical face with large quartz veins.

content.description: First three moves are the hardest. Start holds are a small sloper and and a right pointing flake to the right of the large crack.follow the line straight up to the left of the main crack. Finish is the top-out.
content.location: Follow blue blaze from the book hill parking lot. Look for green to your right. Follow green over the bridge and a hundred feet up the hill. First large boulder on your right.

content.description: Start to the right of The Dyno. Right hand on the arete, left hand on any number of terrible crimps. Move left into the starting edge of The Dyno and find your way to the lip.
content.location: Left of The only dance there is, Right of the Dyno

content.description: One move, but a good one! Stand start one two perfect holds above your head, get your feet on and jump to the bowl edge sloper.
content.location: to the left of The Only Dance

content.description:
This is the stand start to a much harder project. Start with you left hand on an incredible wavy pinch and your right hand around the corner on a perfect ear. Slap up the arete and make a tricky dead point to a slot. Top out. 

  The sit will go at atleast hard V8 if not much harder.  

  Perfect holds and interesting movement. Definitely worth a visit. 

youtube.com/user/wywh3578?f…
content.location: The obvious right arete of the main boulder

content.description:
Two good sized boulders with excellent rock quality offer five or so problems. 

  The boulders are scattered throughout a hardwood forest, making for well lit winter climbing and beautifully speckled lighting in the summer. The conditions are consistent with everywhere else in CT, so bring some bug spray and a lot of water in the summer.
